comments.body: replacing it with `var _ portforward.PortForwarder = fakePortForwarder` should be much saner since this a contract
That already exists a few lines down. IMO it's fine to have both docs and the actual static compile check.

Ack. This is just a temporary commit copied from https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/35329, which is a straight move. In the interest of keeping it a minimal move, I'd prefer not to touch any parts I don't need to in that PR.
Is this supposed to test the case where the client sends more than expected? io.Copy doesn't just stop at len(received) like Read...

I can switch it so the client calls `CloseWrite` on a `net.TCPConn` instead, in which case I can go back to using `io.Copy`. The reason I switched to only reading a certain amount is because the copy won't unblock unless we call `CloseWrite`.
